intro: Rhynchospora albescens, commonly known as the white-flowered flatsedge, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in marshy areas and has slender, grass-like stems with narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often with a white or pale coloration. Rhynchospora albescens plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
